intro: Stevia diversipapposa f. breviaristata, commonly known as the short-awned stevia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and climates, making it adaptable to different environments. It is also valued for its potential use in herbal medicine and as a natural sweetener. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
